title: Bolsonaro's Arrest: A Political Crisis in Brazil
summary: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro was arrested by federal police on Saturday under orders from Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes. The arrest was prompted by suspicions that Bolsonaro was plotting to escape and avoid starting a 27-year prison sentence for his role in leading a coup attempt after his electoral defeat in 2022. Bolsonaro had been under house arrest and was required to wear an ankle monitor due to being deemed a flight risk. Justice de Moraes cited a violation of the ankle monitor early Saturday and expressed concerns that Bolsonaro might flee during a protest organized by his son later that day. The judge also mentioned potential escape routes, such as heading to the U.S. Embassy in Brasilia, and referenced past instances where Bolsonaro's allies left Brazil to avoid jail. Bolsonaro's lawyers disputed the claims, stating the arrest was based on a prayer vigil rather than a protest and caused deep perplexity. The arrest is a preemptive measure and will be reviewed by a five-justice Supreme Court panel on Monday, which previously convicted and sentenced Bolsonaro by a 4-1 vote in September. This event highlights ongoing political tensions and legal battles in Brazil.
